answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Pam,
I looked up some information about this. It may be worth noting that, for a large majority of the programs and requirements that I came across, they apply across the board to Police and Firefighters.
The best resource for people looking for such fitness programs is definitely Glenn Jones' book Police and Fire Physical Fitness, available in the ICMA Bookstore. http://bookstore.icma.org/product1.cfm?product_ID=1133&DID=7
The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department’s Recruit Physical Fitness Assessment Tables is featured in Jones' book.
http://bookstore.icma.org/freedocs/FitnessTest.pdf
Another excerpt from the book details "The Fire Station Workout."
http://bookstore.icma.org/freedocs/Workout.pdf
I hope this helps!
Thanks
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is looking for ways to reduce work-related injuries in the Police Department.  They are interested in establishing a physical fitness policy establishing acceptable criteria for on-duty and off-duty workouts.  
Please forward your policies/references/referrals.  Thank you.
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation

480-231-3538 Text

title: Physical fitness policy: acceptable criteria for on/off-duty workouts
